Adult.description: Plumbeous Vireos tend to be grayer overall than Cassin's Vireos, without Cassin's greenish tones to the back or the yellowish flanks. Plumbeous and Cassin's overlap mainly on their wintering grounds.

Adult (Arizona).description: Bell's Vireos have a partial eyering and dark line through the eye, rather than the strong white "spectacles" of Cassin's Vireo.

Adult.description: Hutton's Vireo lacks the complete eyering of Cassin's Vireo. Hutton's has a dingy throat without the neat contrast of gray head and white throat of Cassin's.
Blue-headed Vireo has a more blue-gray head that contrasts with a greener back and more yellowish flanks than Cassin's Vireo. The two species have little range overlap.
